intro: Sphaerocodon caffrum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its spherical, greenish-yellow flower head, which resembles a dandelion. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is typically found in open, sandy or rocky soils. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance. Sphaerocodon caffrum thrives in full sun and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
